reviews.title: relaxing holiday
reviews.text: just had a week in the electra palace, we had a lovely time, the hotel was very clean, maid service brilliant, food was very good. hotel staff very helpful, we had trouble with our room safe, fixed immediately. no noise at night, planes not a problem. the hotel is in a quiet area but not too far from other shops and bars if you want a change of scenery. highly recommend this hotel. we travelled with sunstar leisure, no problem.

reviews.title: excellent
reviews.text: I holiday 4 times a year. Since my first visit to Electra Palace I have been back 8 times. I stayed at this hotel in may for 2 weeks and could not wait to get back in sept. I have nothing but full praise for all the staff. The hotal is so very clean and the choice of food is execellent. This hotal is worth a visit just for the pool. But if I had one award it would go to this years entertainment team. They all worked so hard from morning to night. Its a real shame poeple dont move from the bar to join in all the fun. I would hope they are all back next year so i can see them in May for my 10th visit.
Keep up the good work, well done.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: We first stayed at the Electra Palace in October 2003, when we booked it as a very last minute package deal. We enjoyed the place so much, we decided to visit again. Second time around we booked direct and made our own flight arrangements, staying in October 2005. On both occasions we had "all-inclusive" deals.
reviews.title: So good we came back!

reviews.text: The hotel and staff don't disappoint and they are consistent - the standards haven't dropped in the two years since we last stayed. The rooms are comfortable and the pool is great - plenty of room, so that you're not all on top of each other. There's also the option of hiring sun beds at the front of the hotel, overlooking the beach, rather than the swimming pool. It's worth the small cost. The restaurant is as you would expect for a large hotel, but there is always a really good choice of food and it's well prepared. They have theme nights from time to time and there is always the option of booking to dine in the "a la carte" restaurant.
reviews.title: Great holiday
Really OK
reviews.text: The hotel entertainments team organise activities throughout the day and entertainment is provided every evening.

reviews.title: restful holiday
reviews.text: The only issue with this hotel is the location. On the plus side, it's about 10-15 minutes from the airport and costs just 10 euros or so for an independent taxi transfer. On the downside, the surrounding area doesn't have much going on. There are a few bars and tavernas in the vicinity and shops and "supermarkets" are a relatively short walk away. You have to go to Rhodes Town is about 10 minutes away by bus and taxi for any real variety. There are plenty of sightseeing opportunities.

reviews.title: Food Glorious Food
reviews.text: As ever, the Greeks are charming and give you a warm welcome wherever you go. I highly recommend this hotel as suitable for singles, couples and families all ages. It offers great value and I can't fault it in any way.

I stayed in this hotel in July 2005 and I have to tell you we had a fab time. The food was really nice, the staff were really friendly especially Harris the restaurant manager george was also very nice. It was very clean and to be honest you could not ask for better. After reading some of these reviews I am sure they did not stay in the same hotel as I did. The rainbow bar what a place really friendly and they looked after you I did think it was alistair Mcgowen i would go back to the Electra Palace and if you are booked there you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: what are you talking about
Complete relaxation
reviews.text: we spent one week at the Electra Palace Hotel.It was wonderful.The food was excellent,so many different choices to suit all tastes and plenty of it.the cleanliness of the hotel was outstanding,clean towels and bedlinen daily.the whole hotel was clean and tidy as was the pool and patio areas.There was plenty of sunloungers really nice ones,which suprised me in peak season.the beach outside the hotel was spotless and the seawater was crystal clear and so warm.There was a nice constant breeze on the beach.The entertainment each night was varied and performed by their own entertainment team,it possibly could have been improved by bringing in outside artists however it was entertaining and they did work very hard.A trip around the village of Trianta in the little yellow train is a must ,it is relaxing and gives an insight into how the locals live.It costs 3 euros for an adult and 1.5 euros for chidren, the trip lasts about an hour.There are small clusters of shops about 10 minutes walk from the hotel with good gift buys.We really enjoyed our holiday it was everything we wanted.

Our first all inclusive holiday was a real success. The freedom to get a drink or a snack at any time without having to carry money a real treat. There was none of the excess drinking we had always imagined would accompany this type of deal.
reviews.title: fantastic!
Fantastic Holiday
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel in an ideal location. Peaceful, and at first you fear isolated.But to one side there are two comfortable, very friendly bars. When the hotel bars shut at midnight the late drinkers move here. And if you are still hungry Nicos makes a wonderful pizza and White Hot Chocholate to die for!
Across the beach the other way and you are in 'bar street' in a couple of minutes.
reviews.title: definately recommended

description: Constructed on 1974 and renovated to a high standard in 2006, The Electra Palace Hotel in Rhodes is decorated in Art Deco style and it portrays loyally the sophistication of the Italian flair of the island. The Electra Palace Hotel, situated on the western coast of Rhodes, consists of two buildings, twenty meters away from the sea front and very near the village of Trianta. Three restaurants offer a variety of ambiance, style and choice of theme eating and the three bars of the hotel provide the opportunity of choosing between the sea or pool view. Card table area and TV room with a large screen, Internet Corner, Sports facilities, Basket-Ball, Volley-Ball and Tennis court, swimming pools and shops. All rooms have private balconies overlooking the Aegean, the pool or its magnificent gardens. Except of the standard rooms Junior suites, Family and Executive suites are available to satisfy the most demanding customer. Other children hotel facilities include a playground, a mini club, baby cots, high chairs, children’s menu for lunch and dinner, a juniors club with internet access, RPG games and Nintendo corner.
